meanings.definition: To divide into three equal parts.
meanings.sent1: She trisected the cake to share with her two friends.
meanings.sent2: The ruler trisected the line into three equal segments.
meanings.sent3: The magician trisected the scarf into three pieces, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: The decision trisected the team, causing disagreements among the members.
meanings.sent5: The farmer trisected the field, creating three equal plots for planting.

meanings.sent1: The trisected pie was perfect for the three siblings to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: The trisected triangle had equal sides and angles.
meanings.sent3: The trisected cake looked like a work of art with its three identical layers.
meanings.sent4: The trisected room felt spacious yet cozy with its three distinct areas.
meanings.sent5: The trisected document made it easy for each team member to focus on their section.
